main event: On 6 November 1957, a witness in Anaheim, California reported seeing a bright, elliptical, silver object about 100 feet in diameter hovering at an estimated height of 800 to 1000 feet. The object was perfectly still for approximately 2-3 minutes and then accelerated rapidly, disappearing in a matter of seconds.
interesting points: The witness was a high school student who observed the object while watching television. He reported the sighting to the local Air Force, and subsequent investigation showed no evidence to substantiate the claim.
The witness reported the sighting of the object to the local Air Force for two days.
The witness, a high school student, was impressed by the publicity given to him.
The report indicates a subsequent check of the area by a civilian investigator found no evidence to substantiate the claim.
.The witnesses' sincere demeanor was noted, and subsequent check of the area revealed no evidence to substantiate the claim, leading to doubts about the reliability of the witness at the time.
sighted object: bright, elliptical, silver object about 100 feet in diameter
